intro: Miconia larensis, commonly known as the Lareño miconia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in length. It produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom throughout the year. Miconia larensis is also known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its potential use in horticulture due to its ornamental foliage.
